{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's age, the location of the lesion in the middle third of the femur, the presence of lytic lesions on x-ray, and the biopsy findings of small round blue cells are all indicative of Ewing sarcoma. Osteosarcoma usually presents with a sunburst pattern on x-ray and is more common in the distal femur. Osteochondroma is a benign tumor that presents as a painless mass. Osteoid osteoma presents with night pain that is relieved by NSAIDs, which is not the case in this patient.", "answer_choice": "C"}
